Table of Contents

Name


CplantInitCollective, CplantDoneCollective

Synopsis


#include <cplant.h> int CplantInitCollective(int *tmout) void CplantDoneCollective(void)

Description


The Cplant*Grp functions make use of the collective operations of the Cplant server library. Before an application can use these functions, every process in the parallel application must call CplantInitCollective (even if only a subset will be using the calls). In this call the structures required for server library collective communication are set up, and the processes synchronize. Upon returning from the call, the Cplant*Grp functions may safely be called. The tmout in seconds is the length of time the call will wait for the synchronization to complete before determining that the call has failed. CplantDoneCollective may be called when the collective functions are no longer needed. It frees the memory required to support the collective operations of the server library.

Return Value


CplantInitCollective returns -1 on error and zero on success.

See Also


CplantSpawnJobGrp CplantFamilyStatusGrp CplantMyParentGrp CplantMySelfGrp CplantInterjobBarrierGrp CplantBarrierStatusGrp CplantFamilyTerminationGrp CplantFamilyMapGrp
